name: Litian Ma
summary: Litian Ma is a seasoned Software Engineer at Google with a strong focus on Video Generative AI and extensive experience in cloud-based AI technologies.
work_history: Google (2019 - Present): Software Engineer in Sunnyvale, CA, focusing on Video Generative AI projects including Vertex RAG, Text-to-live-image, Gemini Multimodal with video, Multimodal Embedding, and Video Descriptions. Past roles include Google Cloud Platform - Vertex AI Vision and Netsoft, working on live video analytics, streams, and network optimization. Amazon (2018 - 2019): Software Development Engineer in Seattle, Washington, working on the Amazon Selection and Catalog System - Browse Assignment Platform Team, utilizing technologies like Spark, AWS Kinesis, and Spring MVC. University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (2016 - 2018): Graduate Teaching Assistant, teaching courses in Database Systems, Artificial Intelligence, Data Structures, and Computer Architecture. Amazon (2017): Software Engineer Intern in Seattle, focusing on a next-generation navigation platform for Amazon's retail website. INESA R&D CENTER (2016): Software Engineer Intern in Shanghai, working on crowd density monitoring and location-based advertising in the smart streetlight system.
project_history: Vertex RAG, Text-to-live-image, Gemini Multimodal with video, Multimodal Embedding, Video Descriptions, Live Video Analytics and Streams, Agile planning and rapid deployment for Google's production network, Next generation navigation platform for Amazon retail website, Crowd density monitoring and location-based advertising in smart streetlight system.
skills: Python, C++, C, Kubernetes, Go, Typescript, Spark, AWS Kinesis, Spring MVC, Java, Apache Hadoop, Computer Vision, Druid
education: University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign: Master’s Degree in Computer Science (2016 - 2018). Shanghai Jiao Tong University: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (2012 - 2016).
